tool_description: Convert HTML/PDF to ZPL for Zebra label printers

api_list.name: HTML to ZPL
api_list.description: Converts an HTML document to a ZPL label. The HTML to ZPL API accepts 3 parameters: height, width, and html content. Note that HTML or body tags are not required.

required_parameters.name: html
required_parameters.description: The HTML body that will be printed onto the label
required_parameters.default: Hello World! ZPL label generated by htmltozpl.com

required_parameters.name: width
required_parameters.description: The width of the label in inches

required_parameters.name: height
required_parameters.description: The height of the label in inches

optional_parameters.name: dpi
optional_parameters.description: The Zebra printer resolution in dpi (dots per inch). Can be either 203, 300, or 600. The default value is 203.

api_list.name: PDF to ZPL
api_list.description: Converts a PDF document into ZPL code. The PDF to ZPL API requires 3 parameters: height, width, and a base64 encoded PDF file.

required_parameters.name: width
required_parameters.description: The width of the label in inches

required_parameters.name: height
required_parameters.description: The height of the label in inches

required_parameters.name: pdfBase64
required_parameters.description: The base64 encoded PDF file to be converted

optional_parameters.name: rotate
optional_parameters.description: The number of degrees to rotate. Must be one of: 0 (no rotation), 90 (rotate right), 180 (upside-down), 270 (rotate left).

optional_parameters.name: scale
optional_parameters.description: Scaling options to fit the PDF on the label. Options include: contain, cover, fill, fitToWidth, fitToHeight.

optional_parameters.name: dpi
optional_parameters.description: The Zebra printer resolution in dpi (dots per inch). Can be either 203, 300, or 600. The default value is 203.
